subsidy.description: Amount deducted from MRP. Customer pays (MRP - S) upfront.

monthly_fee.description: Base monthly subscription fee before rewards/penalties.

tenure_months.description: Minimum contract duration. Customer commits for this period.

deposit.description: Refundable security deposit. Buffer against default/damage.

reward_rate.description: Percentage discount on monthly fee for usage below baseline.
reward_rate.mechanism: If usage is X% below baseline, customer gets (r * X)% discount on fee

penalty_rate.description: Percentage surcharge on monthly fee for usage above baseline.
penalty_rate.mechanism: If usage is X% above baseline, customer pays (p * X)% extra on fee

baseline_setting_method.description: How energy usage baseline is set for rewards/penalties
baseline_setting_method.recommendation: Start with fixed_by_plan for simplicity, move to personalized once data collected

participation_constraint.verbal: Customer must prefer SESP over buying outright
participation_constraint.threshold_meaning: SESP must be at least 10% better than purchase in NPV terms
participation_constraint.notes: Must use customer's discount rate (high) for NPV calculation

profitability_constraint.verbal: Company must achieve minimum target margin
profitability_constraint.notes: Must use firm's discount rate (low) for NPV calculation

cashflow_constraint.verbal: Cumulative cash flow must not go too negative
cashflow_constraint.max_negative_meaning: No more than ₹10,000 cash out of pocket per unit at any point
cashflow_constraint.notes: Critical for working capital planning. High subsidy creates early cash outflow.

incentive_compatibility_constraint.verbal: Each customer type should prefer the plan designed for them
incentive_compatibility_constraint.mathematical: For all types θ: U(θ, plan_θ) >= U(θ, plan_other)
incentive_compatibility_constraint.example: Heavy user should not benefit from choosing Light plan
incentive_compatibility_constraint.mechanism: Achieved through baseline setting and penalty structure
incentive_compatibility_constraint.notes: Without IC, heavy users game the system by choosing cheap plans

moral_hazard_constraint.verbal: Penalty for overuse must deter overuse behavior
moral_hazard_constraint.rationale: Penalty need not fully offset benefit, but must be substantial enough to discourage
moral_hazard_constraint.notes: Value of extra usage proxied by electricity cost of that usage

market_constraint.verbal: SESP must be competitive with alternatives

checks.name: vs_rental
checks.rationale: Can be up to 30% more than rental because new appliance + smart features

checks.name: vs_emi_24m
checks.rationale: Should be at least 10% cheaper than 24-month EMI

primary.name: maximize_firm_margin
primary.description: Find pricing that maximizes company margin while satisfying all constraints

secondary.name: maximize_customer_savings
secondary.description: Maximize customer benefit vs purchase alternative

secondary.name: minimize_break_even_period
secondary.description: Recover subsidy as fast as possible

secondary.name: maximize_adoption_rate
secondary.description: Price attractively enough to drive volume

objectives.multi_objective_approach: Pareto frontier analysis - show trade-offs between margin and customer savings

conservative.description: Low subsidy, moderate fee, longer tenure - prioritizes profitability

balanced.description: Balanced approach - moderate on all dimensions

aggressive.description: High subsidy, low fee - prioritizes adoption/market share

premium.description: Low subsidy, high fee, premium features - for affluent segment
